title: Don't be fooled by a picture of a happy cow: how to decode the labels on meat
text:
Do you know your 'Organic' from your 'Free-Range'? Stroll through any supermarket meat aisle and you've greeted by labels. But what exactly do they all mean? Here's what you should know...

When buying meat or eggs, don’t be fooled by a photograph of a happy cow or free-roaming chicken. Meat marketing is famously misleading, with some supermarkets known to use the names of non-existent farms to help sell their produce.

All you need to look for is the label on the packaging, which is legally required in many cases.

An Organic label, marked by a green leaf logo, means the animal was reared to the highest health and welfare standards. It was allowed to roam freely outside, with plenty of space...
description: Do you know your 'Organic' from your 'Free-Range'?
